books.title: Pericles
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Tyrian prince flees after he discovers a terrible secret.

books.title: The Fur Country
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A group of colonists attempt to settle in the Arctic Circle.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: A young girl follows a white rabbit into a strange land of poetry, humor, and whimsy.

books.title: Misalliance
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On a pleasant summer afternoon, a sudden plane crash followed by a would-be assassin interrupt a family’s conversations about marriage.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: Dr. Mabuse, the Gambler
books.author: Norbert Jacques
books.summary: A detective hunts a criminal mastermind and hypnotist in the gambling dens of post-Great-War Munich.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: The Secret Adversary
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: Tommy and Tuppence try to solve a mystery, only to find themselves embroiled in schemes of murder, millionaires, and diplomats.

books.title: Aspects of the Novel
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: E. M. Forster offers an analysis of aspects of the novel.

books.title: An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
books.author: David Hume
books.summary: Hume examines the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality and human understanding.

books.title: The Columbiad
books.author: Joel Barlow
books.summary: Columbus is shown a history of the western hemisphere since his discoveries.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: The Maracot Deep
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A scientific expedition stumbles upon the remnants of Atlantis.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A collection of short stories by H. G. Wells in a variety of genres ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Pilgrim’s Progress
books.author: John Bunyan
books.summary: An allegorical story of a pilgrim in search of redemption, followed later by his wife and children, passing through great trials before reaching the Celestial City.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
